intro: Keteleeria pubescens, commonly known as the Chinese fir, is a species of coniferous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cones, which are typical of the Cupressaceae family. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against environmental stress. Keteleeria pubescens plays an important ecological role in forest ecosystems, offering habitat and food for various wildlife species.
